editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: ORIGEN, HOMILIES ON O.T. BOOKS, VOL. II; S. XII ex.

msItem.note: On the front pastedown is a table of contents, s. xv in.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Joshua
msItem.rubric: Incipit proemium expositionis Origenis in Ihesum Naue
msItem.incipit: Donauit Deus nomen quod est super omne nomen
msItem.explicit: est uerus Israel in Christo Iesu d. n. per quem ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit omelia xxvi in libro Iesu Naue
msItem.note: CPG 1420; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 29 (1920), pp. 286–463; SChr 71 (1960).

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Judges
msItem.rubric: Incipit expositio Origenis in librum Iudicum
msItem.incipit: Lector quidem presentis lectionis ita legebat
msItem.explicit: ab ipso uictoriam consequi mereamur in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1421; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 30 (1920), pp. 464–522.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homily on I Samuel
msItem.rubric: Incipit ix. in regnorum de Helchana et Fenenna et Anna
msItem.incipit: Non tunc tantummodo Deus plantauit paradisus
msItem.explicit: ut in nouitate uite ambulem in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1423; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 1–25.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Isaiah
msItem.incipit: Quam diu Ozias rex uixit non potuit uisionem uidere Ysaias propheta
msItem.explicit: et efficeris Filius Dei in Christo Iesu cui ...
msItem.note: CPG 1437; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 242–89; Lambert 209.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Jeremiah
msItem.rubric: Incipit expositio Origenis in Ieremiam omelia prima
msItem.explicit: in commune populum suum omnipotentem Deum cum Christo Iesu cui ...

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Ezechiel
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus in expositionem Origenis super Ezechielem
msItem.incipit: Magnum quidem est amice quod postulas
Non omnis qui captiuus est propter peccata
msItem.explicit: iter facere glorificantes Deum omnipotentem per Iesum Christum ...
msItem.finalRubric: In Ezechiel propheta omelia xiiii. explicit

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on the Song of Songs
msItem.note: Preceded by his letter to Damasus
msItem.rubric: Incipit epistola Ieronomi ad Damasum papam de post Origene transferente in epithalamicis carminibus
msItem.incipit: Beatissimo pape Damaso Ieronimus. Origenes cum in ceteris libris omnes uicerit
Quomodo dicimus per Moysen esse quedam non solum sancta
msItem.explicit: efficiamur sponsi sermone sapientia Iesu Christo cui ...
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit omelia ii. Origenis in Cantica Canticorum
msItem.note: CPG 1432; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 26–60; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6199; Lambert 206.

supportDesc.extent:
125 leaves 420 290
310 200
The edges retrimmed and stained yellow.
supportDesc.collation: a pastedown at each end, 1–158, 166(6 canc.), the quires numbered at the end as far as 9; thereafter sporadic catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with plummet in 2 cols of 43 lines.

decoDesc.decoNote: Large plain red, blue, green or buff initials, except for a 5-line D on f. 30v, blue on a pink ground, with foliage in yellow and orange. Red tituli, diples, and running heads on a separate ruled line.

binding.p: Late medieval: square-edged oak boards with slightly projecting squares, bared and backed with modern vellum; sewn on four bands. Formerly two narrow straps from recesses in the front board to pins in the back, replaced with catches. Formerly corner bosses on both boards. Rivets and marks of the large iron chain-staple near the foot of the rear board and pastedown. Formerly brass chain-staples at the foredge of the front board, near head and foot. Rust-marks at the foot of the front pastedown and early leaves, near the foredge, may be from a chain-staple used with a previous binding.

history.provenance: Doubtless made in an English religious house.

On the front pastedown, s. xv, ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton’ in Oxon’ ex dono magistri Walteri Rommesbury inceptoris theologie, precentoris in ecclesia Herefordensi, ac quondam prefate domus consocii. Oretis igitur, &c.’. Rammesbury (BRUO 1544–5), fellow in 1360, still in 1381, canon of Hereford from c. 1368, d. before Nov. 1406. He gave new desks to the library in 1394, and MSS 5, 15, 92–3. Also ‘N. 1. 4. Art:’, s. xvii, canc. and replaced with ‘A. 2. 4’ in purple ink, s. xix, and modern ‘(IV.)’ in red; the College bookplate. At the head of f. 1 is the James no. ‘25’ (recte 251), s. xvii in. ‘4’ is inked, upside down, on the foredge.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
